snippet: As President Obama seeks a solution that will satisfy the ideological and political tests of both parties, he faces complaints from Democrats who say he mishandled his last attempt at a “grand bargain.”
abstract: Political Memo observes that as Pres Obama seeks to salvage big-deficit-reduction deal with solution that will satisfy ideological and political tests of both parties, he faces complaints from Democrats who say he mishandled his last attempt at such a grand bargain.

byline.original: By RICHARD W. STEVENSON and JOHN HARWOOD

lead_paragraph: As President Obama seeks a solution that will satisfy the ideological and political tests of both parties, he faces complaints from Democrats who say he mishandled his last attempt at a “grand bargain.”

headline.seo: Obama Bucks Democrats in Search of Budget Deal
headline.main: In Search of Debt Deal, Obama Walks a Narrow Path
headline.print_headline: Obama Seeks to Bridge Partisan Divide in Search of a Budget Deal
